subject: CBS Evening News with Katie Couric E-Mail Alert
body:

  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours
    | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday
    Morning | Face The
    Nation 















Hi everyone,
 
I'll be anchoring our broadcast tonight from Chicago, the unofficial capital of the Midwest
  — known for its deep-dish pizza, vibrant sports teams and rich
  political history. 
 
We’ll bring you up to date on the political significance
  of the Windy City
  to the presidential race, and I'll be taking a look at the life of one of the
  favorite sons of Illinois
  politics today: Senator Barack Obama. 
 
Overseas, Saudi police have arrested more than 170
  militants who planned to carry out suicide attacks against oil facilities and
  public figures, according to the Interior Ministry. Richard Roth will have
  more on this massive bust of terror suspects.
 
Former CIA director George Tenet's memoir will be
  released next week and it's already making a stir in Washington. Jim Axelrod will give us a
  preview of what Tenet is likely to reveal in "At the Center of the
  Storm." 
 
And Senior Political Correspondent Jeff Greenfield
  will give you an overview of last night’s debate of Democratic
  presidential hopefuls.
 
There's a new gold rush in the Midwest.
  But this time, the prized loot is not a mineral — it's a vegetable. As
  Cynthia Bowers will report, farmers are planting record crops of corn this
  season to keep up with the growing demand for the corn-derived fuel additive
  ethanol. 
 
Finally, I'll give you a look at the political
  character of the Windy
City, from its earliest
  days right up to the 2008 election. I hope you'll join me.
 
Have a great weekend! 
 




Katie Couric
CouricandCo@cbs.com
